posts.post_content:
On its own, this is a cute trick that I would play just for the random fun value.  
  
Played after [Vanishment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vanishment) or [Temporal Spring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temporal Spring),   
this card effectively reads "Gain control of target nonland permanent".  
  
Played after [Memory Lapse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memory Lapse), it's essentially [Spelljack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spelljack) in two easy payments.
posts.html:
On its own, this is a cute trick that I would play just for the random fun value.

Played after Vanishment or Temporal Spring,
this card effectively reads "Gain control of target nonland permanent".

Played after Memory Lapse, it's essentially Spelljack in two easy payments.

posts.post_content:
Not too shabby. Even without knowing what's on top of the opponent's deck, this is great disruption. Got myself a [Howlgeist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howlgeist) and a [Wolfir Silverheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Silverheart) with this little beauty at prerelease in the same round, and beat face with my opponent's own creatures. He was not pleased. Sorry, dude!  
  
Fun card.
